artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsujiokaya Kamekichi; Carver: Watanabe Yatarō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 479.12; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 193, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets; woman at left wearing grey and blue striped kimono with red garment underneath and holding a folded cloth in her mouth, looking over her PR shoulder; woman at right wearing black hood and garments, looking at a man in blue stripes; another woman holding up a drunk man behind first woman; woman in grey and purple stripes at left edge of right image
dimension: 14 3/4 × 10 in. (37.47 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫弥太 {hori Yata}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Newly Selected Eastern Brocade Prints (Shinsen Azuma nishiki-e 新撰東錦絵)
title: Story of Shiraito of the Hashimotoya
